label: Room 40
description:
Maverick electro-acoustic composer Marina Rosenfeld returns to Room 40, host of 2009’s standout ‘P.A./Hard Love’ album, with an investigation of dub plate decay and the haptic, physical interaction of skin, sweat and grime on acetate, with results recalling Bellows, Stephan Mathieu, early Wanda Group

“For over two decades, New York-based artist and composer... more

label: Mappa Editions
description:
Glaswegish dream weaver Cucina Povera keeps the magick flowing with her 2nd album of 2021, following the outstanding ‘Lumme’ with a haul of tracks recorded while stranded in a scottish snowstorm back in 2017, tracing an icy path between ancient folk, choral music, Islaja, Lau Nau and Grouper - just next level really.

There's a weightlessness to Cucina... more

title_full:
James Rushford

              —

              (Shelter Press)
label: Shelter Press
description:
James Rushford tops over a decade of solo and collaboratibve work with Oren Ambarchi, Crys Cole, Will Guthrie, Graham Lambkin and Klaus Lang on this fathoms-deep, psychedelic treat, a next-level arrangement of microtonal drone, decaying concréte fuzz and windswept, somber melancholia recorded for the Shelter Press label.

James Rushford impressed... more

title_full:
Alois Yang

            —
            MLMC Live At Punctum

label: Metaphon
description:
Stunning archival material from groundbreaking percussionist Michael Ranta - a collaborator with Stockhausen and Conny Plank, highly regarded for his bridging of East/West avantgarde movements - here playing to the breadth of his style between 1971-1978

’Taiwan Years’ supplies another highlight to the Metaphon label (Timo Van Lujik’s home of critical Ranta... more

label: PAN
description:
Berlin mainstay Ziúr shatters her musical glass ceiling with this completely essential, exalted, airlock dub pop masterpiece. Jagged, genre-bleached instrumentals that sound like John Carpenter, Talk Talk and AFX mucking with the dials at Black Ark Studios.

Sometimes it takes a period of dramatic change to truly channel the creative mind. For Ziúr, lockdown meant... more

title_full:
Bookworms

              —
              Alternative Group
            
              (Boomkat Editions | Documenting Sound)
label: Boomkat Editions | Documenting Sound
description: One of NYC’s most curious, fwd mutants Nik Dawson aka Bookworms weaves ancestral rhythms and tempered modular tonalities to express his feelings for Documenting Sound. It’s an Escher-like labyrinth of torched sound design and bleary-eyed isolationist experiments that are both Psychedelic and complex but never impenetrable, digesting like an... more

label: Youth
description:
YOUTH host Significant Other’s glum but resilient meditation on love and loss, a broodingly therapeutic debut album that straddles IDM and industrial Ambient signatures, reminding us of work from Bola to Jay Glass Dubs, Spectre to classic late night Rob Hall mixes.

Sharing a different side of his sound to that heard on club-cut 12”s for Spe:c, Oscilla Sound and... more

title_full:
Francisco López

              —
              Hidden Island Music (untitled #398)
            
              (Keroxen / Keroxen (Discrepant))
label: untitled #398
description:
Francisco López explores the hidden sounds of Tenerife on this extended study, layering industrial recordings with expertly recorded environmental sounds to create a mind-expanding alien sound-world. 

It feels like a privilege to absorb recordings as detailed and microscopic as these. López is a master of his craft, the Hendrix of the microphone, and brings out... more

release: You Can See Your Own Way Out
title_full:
Jefre Cantu-Ledesma & Ilyas Ahmed

              —
              You Can See Your Own Way Out
            
              (Devotion)
label: Devotion
description:
Two eternal shoegazers render their first collaboration after many years in orbit of each other, resulting in a swoon-worthy suite of vaporous vignettes and loner strums textured with immersive field recordings

Presented as a kind of collection of short stories, ‘You Can See Your Own Way Out’ sees the longtime pals finally combine their talents - Ahmed’s... more

label: Dais Records
description: Manchester family Space Afrika's Dais debut is a sprawling, genre melted tapestry of charged diasporic innovation and unshakably Northern, British working class eccentricity >> Like Dean Blunt, DJ Spooky, Cocteau Twins, Klein, West Mineral, Tricky, Third Eye Foundation, Actress 'n Michael Nyman boiled into a waxy narrative epic, 'Honest Labour' is as smoky... more

title_full:
Kelman Duran

              —
              Night In Tijuana
            
              (Scorpio Red)
label: Scorpio Red
description: Kelman Duran fades to dusk on this killer, smeared new album of steamy, syncopated kicks, spiritual jazz and haunted, weightless textures, nailing a singular sort of ambient dembow folk modernism that comes with our highest possible recommendation - and especially so if yr feeling Nala Sinephro, Space Afrika, Tara Clerkin Trio, Amazondotcom... more
